meanings.definition: A tall pole used to display a flag.
meanings.sent1: The flagpole stood proudly in front of the school building.
meanings.sent2: The American flag fluttered in the wind on the flagpole.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel climbed the flagpole and pretended to be a flag.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a flagpole, unwavering in the face of challenges.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the silhouette of the flagpole against the sky was striking.

meanings.definition: To mark or identify with a flagpole.
meanings.sent1: They decided to flagpole the entrance to the park for the event.
meanings.sent2: The team flagpoled their territory with colorful banners.
meanings.sent3: The kids playfully flagpoled their clubhouse with old socks.
meanings.sent4: She flagpoled her luggage with a bright ribbon to easily spot it at the airport.
meanings.sent5: The garden was flagpoled with tiny flags to celebrate the occasion.
